answers.answer: In the later stages of pregnancy yes. They normally get u in every 2 or 3 weeks at first and you may have extra tests n ultrasounds. But as yiu get closer to due date they will get you in more often
Yes. Im high risk and see my doctor every 2 wks and I also get an ultrasound every 2wks at the hospital. I scheduled both appointments the same day to limit my traveling days.
I am high risk and I see Dr every 2 week
I was seen alot when I had my twins and toward the last couple months it was every week
sorry but if i may ask what would make woman become high risk? are u having twins? sorry to be nosey im just curious
Many different reasons to be high risk:  twins,  history of preterm labor, gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, heart conditions and other diseases.
I debeloped geststional diabetis at 28 weeks so they said i am a high risk they check me every week and have a sobogram every week since then

I went in every two to three weeks until 28 weeks and now I am every two weeks. Also get an ultrasound at the hospital every four weeks since 20 weeks. I am high risk because birth control with estrogen gives me high blood pressure so with extra estrogen  from pregnancy the want to make sure I dont get preeclampsia
I was seen twice a week, one ultrasound a week and one dr visit a couple days after. And that started happening right away.
Mine was because of high blood pressure.  Ended up having emergency c section due to ruptured placenta at 36 weeks. Luckily this pregnancy is going well.

I'm also high risk (due to an auto immune disorder). I've been seen every 4 weeks on the dot since my first visit and at 26 weeks went to visits every two weeks. Weekly visits will start normally for my situation (around 36 weeks) unless some more urgent issues start arising.

question: With being a high risk pregnancy will my Dr see me more then every 4-6 weeks? I was told he would see me every 2 weeks if not every week is that true?
title: high risk
